thread.title: Volley cops a serve from Christian lobby for using sex to sell sandshoes
thread.title_full: Volley cops a serve from Christian lobby for using sex to sell sandshoes

title: Volley cops a serve from Christian lobby for using sex to sell sandshoes
text:
â€” Whiskey Houston (@RobCoco) January 17, 2017 @wendyjoyfrancis How about you fight for "kid's innocence" by targeting sexual abuse in your churches then? Not enough "holier than thou" in that, maybe? â€” GumbyWench (@gumbywench) January 17, 2017 Advertisement 
The iconic Volley (nee Dunlop) tennis shoe â€“ the shoe of 1976 Australian Open winner Mark Edmondson â€“ is now sold using sex. 
That means a series of photos by Marisa Taschkeâ€‹ featuring young, tanned people in Volleys and not much else. A photo posted by Marisa Taschke Creative (@marisataschke) on Aug 23, 2016 at 3:46pm PDT 
The company has also teamed up with condom manufacturer Ansell to promote safe "rooting". We're making a racquet this year with our new #grassroots campaign ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥ check it out at https://t.co/m84fm1cwcm pic.twitter.com/w83uGebWAL â€” VolleyAustralia (@VolleyAustralia) August 22, 2016 
The adverts, apparently, are about the erosion of freedom. 
"The Grassroots campaign uses our voice to speak to the frustration of many young Australians who feel like, for the first time in a generation, their freedom is being eroded, instead of being advanced," global brand manager, John Szwede, told Mumbrella .
